page.title: 09HOME/FAMILY LIFE NASH AREA
page.content: Family life in the village is conducted at a fast pace. People commute by car to nearby cities or by rail to London, Northampton etc. Children are transported by bus to local schools. Many wives work. This often requires a second car, a structured day and more labour saving devices in the home. Most have washing machines, tumble dryers and vacuum cleaners, some have microwaves to speed up food preparation. Fast food has infiltrated the diet. To limit expense home owners often "Do it Yourself", consequently fewer tradesmen visit. A few homes have security systems, isolated farms relying on guard dogs. Most families have a variety of pets. In an area where hunting is popular horses and ponies are also kept.
